about.title: About AtlasCaucasus
about.subtitle: Your trusted gateway to authentic travel experiences in the heart of the Caucasus

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.p1: AtlasCaucasus was born from a simple idea: the best travel experiences come from authentic local connections. We believe that exploring the Caucasus region—Georgia, Armenia, Azerbaijan, and Turkey—should be more than just checking off tourist attractions. It should be about immersing yourself in rich cultures, tasting traditional cuisines, and hearing stories from the people who call this region home.
mission.p2: Our platform bridges the gap between curious travelers and passionate local guides, tour operators, and drivers who know every hidden trail, every family-owned restaurant, and every breathtaking viewpoint that doesn't appear in guidebooks. We're not just another booking platform—we're a community built on trust, authenticity, and shared love for exploration.
mission.p3: Whether you're seeking adventure in the mountains of Svaneti, wine tasting in Kakheti, or cultural immersion in ancient cities, AtlasCaucasus connects you with verified local experts who craft personalized experiences tailored to your interests. We handle the logistics, you embrace the journey.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Quick answers to common questions about AtlasCaucasus

q1.question: How do I book a tour?
q1.answer: Browse our tour listings, select a tour you like, and click "Request This Tour". Fill out the inquiry form with your details and preferences. The tour provider will respond to your inquiry via email and in-app messaging.

q2.question: Is payment required upfront?
q2.answer: No. AtlasCaucasus is an inquiry-based platform. You connect with providers, discuss your requirements, and arrange payment directly with them based on their policies.

q3.question: Are the guides and tour operators verified?
q3.answer: Yes. We verify all providers on our platform. Look for the "Verified" badge on listings. However, we recommend reviewing ratings, reviews, and communicating directly with providers before confirming any booking.

q4.question: Can I customize a tour?
q4.answer: Absolutely! Most of our providers offer customizable tours. When you send an inquiry, mention your specific interests, preferred dates, and any special requirements. They'll work with you to create a personalized experience.

q5.question: What languages do the guides speak?
q5.answer: Each guide profile lists the languages they speak. Common languages include English, Georgian, Russian, and regional languages. Filter guides by language in the search options.

q6.question: What is your cancellation policy?
q6.answer: Cancellation policies vary by provider. Always discuss and confirm the cancellation terms directly with your chosen tour operator or guide before finalizing any arrangements.

q7.question: Do you offer travel insurance?
q7.answer: We do not provide travel insurance directly. We strongly recommend purchasing comprehensive travel insurance from a reputable provider before your trip.

q8.question: How do I become a tour provider on AtlasCaucasus?
q8.answer: Click "Register" in the top navigation, select "Register as Company", and complete the verification process. Once approved, you can create tour listings and start receiving inquiries.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: AtlasCaucasus.GE ("AtlasCaucasus", "we", "us", or "our") operates a tourism marketplace platform connecting travelers with tour operators, guides, drivers, and companies in the Caucasus region. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our platform.

provided.title: 1.1 Information You Provide
provided.account: Account information: name, email address, password, and phone number when you register.
provided.profile: Profile information: bio, languages spoken, profile photo, and location for guides and drivers.
provided.company: Company information: company name, registration number, description, and website for business accounts.
provided.communication: Communication data: messages sent through our inquiry system and in-app chat.
provided.listings: Tour listings: tour details, pricing, images, and itineraries published by providers.
provided.reviews: Reviews: ratings and comments you leave for providers.

automatic.title: 1.2 Information Collected Automatically
automatic.usage: Usage data: pages visited, features used, search queries, and interaction patterns.
automatic.device: Device information: browser type, operating system, device type, and screen resolution.
automatic.ip: IP address: used for security, fraud prevention, and approximate location.
automatic.cookies: Cookies and similar technologies: see our <1>Cookie Policy for details.

usage.title: 2. How We Use Your Information
usage.intro: We use the information we collect to:

list.communicate: Facilitate communication between travelers and tourism providers through inquiries and chat.
list.display: Display tour listings, guide profiles, driver profiles, and company pages.
list.transactional: Send transactional emails (account verification, password resets, inquiry notifications).
list.notifications: Send notification emails when you receive inquiries or inquiry responses (you can opt out in your profile settings).
list.improve: Improve, personalize, and optimize the platform experience.
list.fraud: Detect and prevent fraud, abuse, and security issues.

sharing.title: 3. How We Share Your Information

list.providers: With tourism providers: When you send an inquiry to a tour operator, guide, driver, or company, they receive your name, email, and the message content to respond to your request.
list.public: Public profile data: Provider profiles (guides, drivers, companies) and their tour listings are publicly visible. Reviews you write are visible to other users along with your first name.
list.service: Service providers: We use third-party services for email delivery (Resend), hosting, and analytics. These providers only access data necessary to perform their services.
list.legal: Legal requirements: We may disclose information if required by law, court order, or government request.

sharing.no_sell: We do not sell your personal information to third parties.

cookies.title: 4. Cookies and Tracking
cookies.text: We use essential cookies for authentication and platform functionality. For detailed information about our cookie practices, please see our <1>Cookie Policy</1>.

list.account: Account data: retained for as long as your account is active. Deleted within 30 days of account deletion request.
list.communication: Communication data: inquiry messages and chat history are retained for 2 years after account deletion for dispute resolution purposes.
list.logs: Usage logs: retained for up to 12 months for security and analytics.
list.backup: Backup data: may persist in encrypted backups for up to 90 days after deletion from primary systems.

rights.title: 6. Your Rights
rights.intro: Depending on your jurisdiction, you may have the following rights regarding your personal data:

list.access: Access: request a copy of the personal data we hold about you.
list.correction: Correction: request correction of inaccurate or incomplete data.
list.deletion: Deletion: request deletion of your personal data (subject to legal retention requirements).
list.portability: Data portability: request your data in a structured, machine-readable format.
list.optout: Opt-out: unsubscribe from notification emails in your profile settings.
list.restriction: Restriction: request restriction of processing in certain circumstances.

rights.contact: To exercise these rights, please contact us at the email address below.

security.title: 7. Data Security
security.text: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect your personal data, including encrypted connections (HTTPS), secure password hashing, and access controls. However, no method of electronic transmission or storage is 100% secure, and we cannot guarantee absolute security.

children.title: 8. Children's Privacy
children.text: Our platform is not intended for children under the age of 16. We do not knowingly collect personal data from children. If you believe a child has provided us with personal data, please contact us and we will delete it promptly.

changes.title: 9. Changes to This Policy
changes.text: We may update this Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of material changes by posting the updated policy on this page and updating the "Last updated" date. Your continued use of the platform after changes are posted constitutes acceptance of the updated policy.

contact.title: 10. Contact Us
contact.text: If you have questions about this Privacy Policy or wish to exercise your data rights, please contact us:

cookies.intro: This Cookie Policy explains how AtlasCaucasus.GE ("we", "us", "our") uses cookies and similar technologies when you visit our platform. It explains what these technologies are, why we use them, and your choices regarding their use.

what_are.title: 1. What Are Cookies?
what_are.text: Cookies are small text files stored on your device (computer, tablet, or mobile phone) when you visit a website. They are widely used to make websites work efficiently, remember your preferences, and provide information to the site operators. Cookies can be "session" cookies (deleted when you close your browser) or "persistent" cookies (remaining on your device for a set period).

essential.title: Essential Cookies
essential.text: These cookies are strictly necessary for the Platform to function. They cannot be disabled.

auth.name: Authentication token
auth.purpose: Keeps you logged in and authenticates API requests

refresh.name: Refresh token
refresh.purpose: Renews your authentication without re-entering credentials

csrf.name: CSRF token
csrf.purpose: Protects against cross-site request forgery attacks

functional.title: Functional Cookies
functional.text: These cookies remember your preferences and choices to provide a more personalized experience.

language.name: Language preference
language.purpose: Remembers your preferred language (English, Georgian, Russian)

local_storage.title: 3. Local Storage
local_storage.intro: In addition to cookies, we use browser local storage for:

list.auth: Authentication state: stores your login session data for a seamless experience across page navigations.
list.prefs: User preferences: stores UI settings such as language and display preferences.

local_storage.text: Local storage data is only accessible by our Platform and is never transmitted to third parties.

third_party.title: 4. Third-Party Cookies
third_party.text: Currently, AtlasCaucasus does not use third-party analytics or advertising cookies. If we introduce such cookies in the future, we will update this policy and request your consent where required by law.

managing.title: 5. Managing Cookies
managing.intro: You can control and manage cookies through your browser settings. Most browsers allow you to:

list.block: Block cookies from specific or all websites.
list.preferences: Set preferences for certain types of cookies.
list.notifications: Enable notifications when cookies are being set.

managing.note: Please note that blocking essential cookies will prevent you from logging in and using core Platform features.

changes.title: 6. Changes to This Policy
changes.text: We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time to reflect changes in our practices or for other operational, legal, or regulatory reasons. The "Last updated" date at the top indicates when the latest changes were made.

contact.title: 7. Contact Us
contact.text: If you have questions about our use of cookies, please contact us:

links.text: For more information about how we handle your personal data, please see our <1>Privacy Policy</1>. For the rules governing your use of the Platform, see our <2>Terms of Service</2>.
